title: Getting Started
text: begin, always, loading package: utilise main data-related functions within package — specifically, search_id() get_genealogy() — active internet connection required. Every mathematician listed Mathematics Genealogy Project (MGP) assigned unique ID. first task locate ID mathematician(s) wish investigate. least two methods accomplish . first option visit MGP website’s search page https://www.mathgenealogy.org/search.php complete search fields. locating desired mathematician navigating data page, notice URL browser’s address bar follows format https://www.mathgenealogy.org/id.php?id=171971, numbers end represent ID (instance, 171971 ID author package). Alternatively, package offers second option allows remain within R session. using function search_id(), can specify search parameters obtain data frame summarising results, including essential ID subsequent steps. output search using family name author package: can seen, search performs partial matches case insensitive. needed, simple regular expression constructs also supported. instance, happened know author’s family name first initial “L”, can narrow search requiring full match family name match first letter given name: likely able find required mathematician without using regular expressions, like beginner’s tutorial use , refer Chapter 15 R Data Science (Wickham et al., 2023).
code: library("maths.genealogy") search_id("aslett") #>       id             name                        university year #> 1 171971    Aslett, Louis           Trinity College, Dublin 2012 #> 2 164179    Haslett, John                                        #> 3 164818 Haslett, Stephen Victoria University of Wellington 1986 #> 4  57304 Laslett, Geofrey    Australian National University 1975 search_id("^aslett$", "^l") #>       id          name              university year #> 1 171971 Aslett, Louis Trinity College, Dublin 2012

title: Getting Started
text: ID 171971 search, can now retrieve author’s genealogical tree: passing ID, function searches entire tree “upwards”, fetching ancestors, well “downwards”, fetching descendants. Note mathematicians modern times, can considerable number ancestors, historical mathematicians, descendant trees may even larger. reasons, get_genealogy() allows disable functions using arguments ancestors descendants passing FALSE.
code: g <- get_genealogy(171971) #> ✔ Connecting to geneagrapher-core WebSocket server [541ms] #> ✔ Sending query [20ms] #> ✔ 🎓 Full genealogy retrieved [1.5s]

title: Getting Started
text: currently two ways plot genealogical tree. first uses Graphviz (Ellson et al., 2004) via DiagrammeR package (Iannone Roy, 2024), second employs ggenealogy package (Rutter et al., 2019). Neither packages specified hard dependency, prompted install attempt use relevant plotting function without requisite packages. Graphviz typically produces best full-tree view can generated using plot_grviz(). Continuing previous example, can accomplished : viewing vignette browser, can zoom using mouse scroll wheel trackpad. Alternatively, can zoom double-clicking zoom holding shift key double-clicking. can pan around dragging plot. render PDF file instead viewing interactively, simply provide file name second argument: alternative, ggenealogy excellent plotting ‘local’ genealogy, showing limited number ancestral/descendant generations, follows:  can also control number ancestral descendant generations displayed using max_anc max_des:  Care need taken sizing plot ensure readable: unlike Graphviz output relies R’s plot scaling.
code: plot_grviz(g) plot_grviz(g, "aslett-tree.pdf") plot_gg(g) plot_gg(g, max_anc = 11)

title: Getting Started
text: Note genealogical tree can built using one mathematician’s ID calling get_genealogy(). result ID used starting point traverse tree ancestors descendants. genealogical tree can constructed using multiple mathematicians’ IDs calling get_genealogy(). use ID starting point traversing tree ancestors descendants, including results single genealogical tree. inspiration package arose discussion drinks package author colleagues Durham University. good way select next example, plots joint genealogical tree built using present starting IDs! Now using plot_grviz() function plot joint genealogy mathematicians specified call get_genealogy(). can difficult plot identify something common interest plotting multiple mathematicians: nearest common ancestor shortest path . can achieved using plot_gg_path(). default, plot shortest path first two mathematicians specified call get_genealogy() built genealogical tree, using x-axis indicate year graduation.  plot different mathematicians, one can use id1 id2 arguments.  id defaults first second mathematicians, one specified, overrides entry .  plot includes common ancestor particularly long name (Weierstraß). Issues like can resolved increasing value expand argument default, 0.15.
code: g <- get_genealogy(c(171971, 108465, 175763, 191788, 169213)) #> ✔ Connecting to geneagrapher-core WebSocket server [558ms] #> ✔ Sending query [33ms] #> ✔ 🎓 Full genealogy retrieved [8.5s] plot_grviz(g) plot_gg_path(g) plot_gg_path(g, id1 = 175763, id2 = 191788) plot_gg_path(g, id1 = 169213) plot_gg_path(g, id1 = 169213, expand = 0.25)

title: Getting Started
text: Development software inspired geneagrapher Python package (https://github.com/davidalber/geneagrapher) makes use WebSocket server running geneagrapher-core (https://github.com/davidalber/geneagrapher-core), designed cache queries MGP reduce load main site. Permission query caching endpoint R package requested granted advance.

title: Getting Started
text: Ellson, J., Gansner, E.R., Koutsofios, E., North, S.C. Woodhull, G. (2004). “Graphviz Dynagraph — Static Dynamic Graph Drawing Tools”. : Jünger, M., Mutzel, P. (eds) Graph Drawing Software, Mathematics Visualization, 127-148. 10.1007/978-3-642-18638-7_6. Iannone, R. Roy, O. (2024). DiagrammeR: Graph/Network Visualization. R package, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=DiagrammeR. Jackson, . (2007). “Labor Love: Mathematics Genealogy Project”, Notices AMS, 54(8), 1002-1003. https://www.ams.org/notices/200708/tx070801002p.pdf Rutter, L., VanderPlas, S., Cook, D. Graham, M.. (2019). “ggenealogy: R Package Visualizing Genealogical Data”, Journal Statistical Software, 89(13), 1-31. doi:10.18637/jss.v089.i13. Wickham, H., Çetinkaya-Rundel, M. Grolemund, G. (2024). R Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, Model Data. 2nd Edition. O’Reilly Media. ISBN: 978-1492097402.

what: Mathematics PhD Genealogy Data and Plotting
title: Mathematics PhD Genealogy Data and Plotting
text: Search mathematicians Mathematics Genealogy Project pull full ancestor /descendent academic genealogical data. latter functionality possible thanks WebSocket server run @davidalber, access directly kind permission. package also provides functionality export genealogical datasets different plotting environments.

title: Mathematics PhD Genealogy Data and Plotting
text: stable binary release can install CRAN: latest development binary can installed R-universe: Alternatively, can install development version source GitHub:
code: install.packages("maths.genealogy") install.packages("maths.genealogy", repos = c("https://louisaslett.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org")) # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("louisaslett/maths.genealogy")

title: Mathematics PhD Genealogy Data and Plotting
text: first task identify ID mathematician(s) like build genealogical data . author package, : , one retrieve full genealogical tree, using id identified search: simplest thing plot whole genealogical tree: Note can also plot shared genealogical tree passing vector ids get_genealogy(). see shared genealogy package author former postdoc supervisor: can interesting see trees share commonality link together. just hone shortest path: functions take various options (see documentation), example two ids can passed get_genealogy() selective shortest path pairs plotted plot_gg_path() using appropriate function arguments. slightly longer introduction, please see Getting Started vignette
code: library("maths.genealogy")  search_id("Aslett", "Louis") g <- get_genealogy(171971) plot_grviz(g) g <- get_genealogy(c(96119, 171971)) plot_grviz(g) plot_gg_path(g)

what: Retrieve genealogy tree by mathematician ID — get_genealogy
title: Retrieve genealogy tree by mathematician ID — get_genealogy
text: Queries genealogy single set mathematicians ID Mathematics Genealogy Project.

title: Retrieve genealogy tree by mathematician ID — get_genealogy
code: get_genealogy(id, ancestors = TRUE, descendants = TRUE)

title: Retrieve genealogy tree by mathematician ID — get_genealogy
text: id integer vector IDs mathematicians genealogy retrieved ancestors logical indicating whether include genealogy backward include ancestors, defaults TRUE. can single logical(1) applies mathematicians referenced id argument, can vector length id providing different selection individual. descendants logical indicating whether include genealogy forward include descendants, defaults TRUE. can single logical(1) applies mathematicians referenced id argument, can vector length id providing different selection individual.

title: Retrieve genealogy tree by mathematician ID — get_genealogy
text: list object class genealogy. element list represents mathematician genealogical tree. name element mathematician's ID Mathematics Genealogy Project. element object list containing: id integer(1) Mathematician's ID; name character(1) containing full name mathematician; institution character(1) containing institution PhD obtained; year integer(1) year PhD completed; descendants integer vector IDs mathematicians supervised individual PhD; advisors integer vector IDs mathematicians supervisors individual PhD. addition, attribute named start_nodes contains integer vector IDs indicating origin nodes used genealogical tree search produced object. words, id argument passed function.

what: maths.genealogy: Mathematics PhD Genealogy Data and Plotting — maths.genealogy-package
title: maths.genealogy: Mathematics PhD Genealogy Data and Plotting — maths.genealogy-package
text: Query, extract, plot genealogical data Mathematics Genealogy Project https://mathgenealogy.org/. Data gathered 'WebSocket' server run 'geneagrapher-core' project https://github.com/davidalber/geneagrapher-core.

title: maths.genealogy: Mathematics PhD Genealogy Data and Plotting — maths.genealogy-package
text: Maintainer: Louis Aslett louis.aslett@durham.ac.uk (ORCID)

what: Plot genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg
title: Plot genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg
text: Plots genealogical tree using ggenealogy layout engine.

title: Plot genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg
code: plot_gg(g, max_anc = 3L, max_des = 3L, id = NULL, col = "red", expand = 0.15)

title: Plot genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg
text: g object class genealogy, returned get_genealogy(). max_anc integer(1) maximum number generations ancestors displayed. max_des integer(1) maximum number generations descendants displayed. id integer(1) character(1) mathematician ID highlight centre tree . default NULL use first ID supplied get_genealogy() retrieving genealogical tree. Note ID must one IDs searched calling get_genealogy() construct g, since search ancestors/descendants goes directly /branches reachable initial search ID. col character(1) specifying colour highlight mathematician one graph centred. expand numeric(1) expansion factor graph. defaults 0.15, larger values causing x axis expand, smaller values shrink. useful nearest common ancestor long name, may cause clipped plotting: increase expansion factor rectify .

title: Plot genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg
text: object class ("gg", "ggplot") can displayed, manipulated using additional layers aesthetic modifications ggplot2 package.

title: Plot genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg
text: function requires ggenealogy package installed. "Suggests" dependency package supports multiple plotting approaches. presence package verified function actually called, providing opportunity install automatically needed. function suitable plotting large whole genealogical trees. Consider using plot_grviz() want see entire tree.

title: Plot genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg
text: Rutter, L., VanderPlas, S., Cook, D. Graham, M.. (2019). “ggenealogy: R Package Visualizing Genealogical Data”, Journal Statistical Software, 89(13), 1-31. doi:10.18637/jss.v089.i13 . Wickham, H. (2016). ggplot2: Elegant Graphics Data Analysis. Springer-Verlag New York.

title: Plot genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg
code: # First, you need to use search_id() to find the mathematician ID for the # individual(s) you wish to plot, or visit https://mathgenealogy.org/ to look # up in the browser.  # Don't test these as rely on internet resources that can be temporarily # unavailable. # \donttest{ # For example, the package author would get their own tree using g <- get_genealogy(171971) #> ⠙ Connecting to geneagrapher-core WebSocket server #> ✔ Connecting to geneagrapher-core WebSocket server [234ms] #>  #> ℹ Sending query #> ✔ Sending query [5ms] #>  #> ℹ 🎓 Fetching PhD data ... #> ✔ 🎓 Full genealogy retrieved [310ms] #>   # Then use the plot_gg() function to use the underlying ggenealogy package plot_gg(g)  # }

what: Plot shortest path in genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg_path
title: Plot shortest path in genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg_path
text: Plots shortest path two mathematicians genealogical tree using ggenealogy layout engine.

title: Plot shortest path in genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg_path
code: plot_gg_path(g, id1 = NULL, id2 = NULL, expand = 0.15)

title: Plot shortest path in genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg_path
text: g object class genealogy, returned get_genealogy(). id1 integer(1) character(1) ID first mathematician interest. id2 integer(1) character(1) ID second mathematician interest. expand numeric(1) expansion factor graph. defaults 0.15, larger values causing x axis expand, smaller values shrink. useful nearest common ancestor long name, may cause clipped plotting: increase expansion factor rectify .

title: Plot shortest path in genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg_path
text: object class ("gg", "ggplot") can displayed, manipulated using additional layers aesthetic modifications ggplot2 package.

title: Plot shortest path in genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg_path
text: function requires ggenealogy package installed. "Suggests" dependency package supports multiple plotting approaches. presence package verified function actually called, providing opportunity install automatically needed. shortest path two mathematician IDs provided plotted, x position label determined year PhD award. NOTE: name nearest common ancestor long, can clipped ggplot2. occurs, increase expand argument greater default 0.15.

title: Plot shortest path in genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg_path
text: Rutter, L., VanderPlas, S., Cook, D. Graham, M.. (2019). “ggenealogy: R Package Visualizing Genealogical Data”, Journal Statistical Software, 89(13), 1-31. doi:10.18637/jss.v089.i13 . Wickham, H. (2016). ggplot2: Elegant Graphics Data Analysis. Springer-Verlag New York.

title: Plot shortest path in genealogical tree with ggenealogy — plot_gg_path
code: # First, you need to use search_id() to find the mathematician ID for the # individual(s) you wish to plot, or visit https://mathgenealogy.org/ to look # up in the browser.  # Don't test these as rely on internet resources that can be temporarily # unavailable. # \donttest{ # For example, to find the shortest genealogical path between the package # author and my former postdoc supervisor, I would start by querying using # both mathematician IDs g <- get_genealogy(c(96119, 171971)) #> ⠙ Connecting to geneagrapher-core WebSocket server #> ✔ Connecting to geneagrapher-core WebSocket server [235ms] #>  #> ℹ Sending query #> ✔ Sending query [6ms] #>  #> ℹ 🎓 Fetching PhD data ... #> ✔ 🎓 Full genealogy retrieved [347ms] #>   # Then use the plot_gg_path() function to use the underlying ggenealogy package plot_gg_path(g)  # }

what: Plot genealogical tree with Graphviz — plot_grviz
title: Plot genealogical tree with Graphviz — plot_grviz
text: Plots genealogical tree either interactively PDF using Graphviz layout engine.

title: Plot genealogical tree with Graphviz — plot_grviz
code: plot_grviz(g, file = "", max_zoom = 200)

title: Plot genealogical tree with Graphviz — plot_grviz
text: g object class genealogy, returned get_genealogy(). file optional file name. file name specified, Graphviz render genealogical tree PDF save file. file name specified, plot rendered interactively RStudio Viewer panel. max_zoom numeric(1) maximum zoom factor plotting Viewer. trees particularly deep wide, default maximum zoom 200x may insufficient, case value larger 200 supplied. option effect plotting file.

title: Plot genealogical tree with Graphviz — plot_grviz
text: filename specified, full path saved file returned character(1) string. filename specified, htmlwidget suitable display RStudio Viewer returned.

title: Plot genealogical tree with Graphviz — plot_grviz
text: function requires DiagrammeR, DiagrammeRsvg either svgPanZoom (interactive) rsvg (pdf output) packages installed. "Suggests" dependencies package supports multiple plotting options. presence packages verified function actually called, providing opportunity install automatically needed.

title: Plot genealogical tree with Graphviz — plot_grviz
text: Ellson, J., Gansner, E.R., Koutsofios, E., North, S.C. Woodhull, G. (2004). “Graphviz Dynagraph — Static Dynamic Graph Drawing Tools”. : Jünger, M., Mutzel, P. (eds) Graph Drawing Software, Mathematics Visualization, 127-148. doi:10.1007/978-3-642-18638-7_6 . Iannone, R. Roy, O. (2024). DiagrammeR: Graph/Network Visualization. R package, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=DiagrammeR. Iannone, R. (2016). DiagrammeRsvg: Export DiagrammeR Graphviz Graphs SVG. R package, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=DiagrammeRsvg. Ooms, J. (2024). rsvg: Render SVG Images PDF, PNG, (Encapsulated) PostScript, Bitmap Arrays. R package, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=rsvg. Riutta, ., Tangelder, J., Russell, K., et al. (2020). svgPanZoom: R 'Htmlwidget' Add Pan Zoom Almost R Graphic. R package, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=svgPanZoom.

title: maths.genealogy 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-07 Catch stray example fail due unavailable internet resources \donttest{}.

title: maths.genealogy 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-06 Correctly quote ‘WebSocket’ DESCRIPTION. Wrap examples fail due unavailable internet resources \donttest{}.

title: maths.genealogy 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-03-03 Add max_zoom argument plot_grviz() enable increasing default maximum zoom plotting particularly deep wide trees. Fixes issue https://github.com/louisaslett/maths.genealogy/issues/1. Additional tidying following final checks first CRAN submission.

title: maths.genealogy 0.1.0
text: Add plot_gg_path() create shortest path plots via ggenealogy. Add plot_gg() enable ggenealogy plots ancestry local mathematician. Create “Getting Started” vignette. Extra error handling get_genealogy() premature WebSocket closure. Add {pkgdown} site. Create warning vignette viewed R-universe. reason embedded graphviz work, see https://github.com/r-universe-org/help/discussions/554. Changes satisfy new lintr rules. README finished .

title: maths.genealogy 0.0.1
text: Add plot_grviz() enable Graphviz plotting RStudio Viewer PDF file. Add get_genealogy() query genealogical tree ‘geneagrapher-core’ WebSocket server. Add disciplines() enable lookup subject IDs supply search_id(). Add search_id() enable searching mathematicians Mathematics Genealogy project: https://mathgenealogy.org/. Create important hex logo! Initial development.
